p: An indication that a passage should be performed one or more octaves above or below its written pitch is represented by the octave element. Its@disand@dis.placeattributes record the amount and direction of displacement, respectively. The@lformattribute captures the appearance of the continuation line associated with the octave displacement. The starting point of the octave displacement may be indicated by either a@tstamp,@tstamp.ges,@tstamp.realor@startidattribute, while the ending point may be recorded by either a@tstamp2,@dur,@dur.gesor@endidattribute. It is a semantic error not to specify one starting-type attribute and one ending-type attribute.
